info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:03PM EDT until July 31 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
FFWLWX
The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Baltimore County in northern Maryland...
* Until 415 PM EDT.
* At 303 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Gauges reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Middle River... Carney... Perry Hall... Rossville... White Marsh... Nottingham...
Honeygo Run near White Marsh has reached moderate flood stage. Rises are likely at Whitemarsh Run at White Marsh are as water flows down the local waterways.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
